content.webTitle: West Brom red-faced over tweet before Marouane Fellaini’s United goal

fields.headline: West Brom red-faced over tweet before Marouane Fellaini’s United goal
fields.bodyText: West Bromwich Albion were made to regret a tweet mocking Marouane Fellaini when the midfielder scored his first goal for Manchester United only four minutes later. The Belgian, who has struggled at Old Trafford since his move from Everton, was brought on by Louis van Gaal for the second half in place of Ander Herrera with West Bromwich leading 1-0. “Fellaini has now taken his tracksuit off, fortunately he has a Man Utd strip on underneath,” ran a tweet on West Brom’s official Twitter account. Fellaini equalised shortly afterwards after chesting down a cross and lashing the ball into the net. The game ended in a 2-2 draw. Albion later wrote a further tweet to say they had meant no offence by their earlier remark. “Sorry if a joke about a footballer not having a shirt on under his tracksuit top has caused such outrage. It was not intended as a slur,” the tweet read.
